Package com.bakdata.dedupe.fusion

Interface ConflictResolution<I,​O>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of the input values.
    O - the type of the output values.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TerminalConflictResolution<I,​O>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Merge
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ConflictResolution<I,​O>
    Solves a conflict during resolution - two or more different values that need to be merged into a single value for the fused representation.

    A conflict resolution may change the value type. For example, a resolution may simply retain all values in a list.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default <O2> @NonNull ConflictResolution<I,​O2> andThen​(@NonNull ConflictResolution<O,​O2> successor)
      Chains two conflict resolution functions, so that if some values remain unresolved after this conflict resolution, the successor will be applied on these remaining alternatives.
      default @NonNull java.util.Optional<O> resolve​(@NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<I>> values, @NonNull FusionContext context)
      Fully resolves the values if possible or throws a FusionException.
      @NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<O>> resolveNonEmptyPartially​(@NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<I>> values, @NonNull FusionContext context)
      Tries the best to resolve the value but may end up with multiple concurrent values.
      default @NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<O>> resolvePartially​(@NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<I>> values, @NonNull FusionContext context)
      Tries the best to resolve the value but may end up with multiple concurrent values.

    • Method Detail

      • resolvePartially

        @NonNull
default @NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<O>> resolvePartially​(@NonNull
                                                                             @NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<I>> values,
                                                                             @NonNull
                                                                             @NonNull FusionContext context)
        Tries the best to resolve the value but may end up with multiple concurrent values.

        For example, if two values "a" and "b" with equal weight remain after prior resolution, this method returns a list of both.

        The return value should be treated as a bag; that is, the order of the values does not matter.

        Parameters:
        values - the potentially empty, unresolved values.
        context - a fusion context with additional configurations.
        Returns:
        the resolved values in a best-effort approach.

      • resolveNonEmptyPartially

        @NonNull
@NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<O>> resolveNonEmptyPartially​(@NonNull
                                                                             @NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<I>> values,
                                                                             @NonNull
                                                                             @NonNull FusionContext context)
        Tries the best to resolve the value but may end up with multiple concurrent values.

        For example, if two values "a" and "b" with equal weight remain after prior resolution, this method returns a list of both.

        The return value should be treated as a bag; that is, the order of the values does not matter.

        Parameters:
        values - the non-empty, unresolved values.
        context - a fusion context with additional configurations.
        Returns:
        the resolved values in a best-effort approach.

      • resolve

        @NonNull
default @NonNull java.util.Optional<O> resolve​(@NonNull
                                               @NonNull java.util.List<@NonNull AnnotatedValue<I>> values,
                                               @NonNull
                                               @NonNull FusionContext context)
        Fully resolves the values if possible or throws a FusionException.

        For example, if two values "a" and "b" with equal weight remain after prior resolution, this method throws the exception.

        Parameters:
        values - the unresolved values.
        context - a fusion context with additional configurations.
        Returns:
        the resolved value or Optional.empty().
        Throws:
        FusionException - if the value cannot be fully resolved.

      • andThen

        @NonNull
default <O2> @NonNull ConflictResolution<I,​O2> andThen​(@NonNull
                                                             @NonNull ConflictResolution<O,​O2> successor)
        Chains two conflict resolution functions, so that if some values remain unresolved after this conflict resolution, the successor will be applied on these remaining alternatives.
        Type Parameters:
        O2 - the type of the new output value.
        Parameters:
        successor - the following conflict resolution.
        Returns:
        the chained conflict resolution function.
